page.title: 06RELIGION PARISH CHURCHES.
page.content: {The church of St John the Baptist, } Berkswell,so named from the spring that bubbles up to the south of the church & in which the first converts to Christianty were baptised.The present building dates from the 12th century.The nave & chancel are fine examples of Norman & Early English architecture.The crypt is Norman & very well preserved.There is a peal of six bells housed in a 15th century tower on which may be seen a sun dial & a clock.Woodcarver Robert Thompson's work can be found by looking for mice carved into the woodwork. {St Andrew's Church Eastern Green, consecrated in 1875 is a red brick building with a spire.Recently an 'upper room' has been built to use for Sunday School & enlarge the capacity of the church.Eastern Green was originally in the parish of Allesley.
